results.title: The Way we were
results.creator_credit: Sydney Pollack, Ray Stark, Rastar Productions and Columbia
results.brief_description: Barbra Streisand and Robert Redford star in one of Hollywood’s legendary love stories. Redford is the boy who sets out to become the top film writer in Hollywood and Streisand is the outspoken activist. Their love binds them together, but their beliefs put them on a collision course which ultimately tears them apart. Redford is charming as the all-American WASP boy, while Streisands performance as the “blue-stocking” Jewish activist is moving, as she vacillates between fragility and passionate committment to her causes. Although uneven and at times unashamedly sentimental, the film is a classic of its genre. Marvin Hamlisch’s score and the title song earned Oscars for the film.

results.title: The Ghost and Mrs. Muir
results.creator_credit: Joseph L Mankiewicz, Fred Kohlmar and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Lucy Muir (Gene Tierney) a beautiful widow and her daughter (Natalie Wood) rent a house by the ocean, and refuse to be frightened by the former owner’s ghost, a dashing sea captain (Rex Harrison). When her income suddenly stops, he suggests that they collaborate on a book about his life and the unlikely pair fall deeply in love. Then Lucy’s affection is challenged by a live man (George Sanders), leaving the broken-hearted captain to choose another course. Acclaimed for its heartwarming screenplay and Oscar-nominated cinematography, this film is a moving, sentimental Hollywood classic.

results.title: Sea wife
results.creator_credit: Bob McNaught, Andre Hakim and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Cast adrift during wartime in the Indian Ocean after a bombing raid on their ship, an RAF officer (Richard Burton) and a nun (Joan Collins) in civilian clothing find themselves attracted to each other. Fighting off attacks by sharks and surviving in the harsh sun, the couple are forced together to brave the elements. The nun gives the officer no encouragement, but he falls madly in love with her and vows to find her again when they return to civilisation. Will she keep her vocation a secret or will she give in to her desires? Based on the novel ‘Sea-Wyf’ by J.M. Sott.

results.title: Truly madly deeply
results.creator_credit: Anthony Minghella, Robert Cooper and BBC Film Unit
results.brief_description: Acclaimed British actors Juliet Stevenson and Alan Rickman star in this wonderfully moving story of love, loss and letting go. Nina lives in her rat-infested flat where she spends most of her time grieving for her dead lover, Jamie. As if in answer to her dreams, Jamie re-enters her life but Nina discovers that living in the past could mean a life without a future.

results.title: Stella Dallas
results.creator_credit: King Vidor, Samuel Goldwyn and Samuel Goldwyn Co
results.brief_description: Barbara Stanwyck gives one of her best performances as a social-climbing mother from the wrong side of the tracks. Born a mill-hand’s daughter with no social graces, an ill-fated marriage leaves Stella single-handedly raising her daughter Laurel (Anne Shirley). Stella dreams of a new life for her daughter until she realises that what stands between Laurel and her dreams is Stella herself. This is a memorable and heartbreaking tale of a mother’s love and ultimate sacrifice - with one of Hollywood’s greatest finales. Don’t watch this film without a box of tissues. Also stars John Boles, Barbara O’Neil and Alan Hale. Based upon the novel by Olive Higgins Prouty.

results.title: The Andromeda strain
results.brief_description: Directed with clinical precision by Robert Wise, this record of the Earth’s first biological crisis is perhaps the most painstakingly authentic science fiction thriller ever made. When a satellite falls to earth near a remote New Mexico village, the recovery team finds everyone in the area dead except an infant and an old derelict. The survivors are brought to a five-storey underground lab - one of the most elaborate and intricate sets ever assembled in Hollywood - where scientists attempt to determine the nature of the deadly microbe before it starts a world-wide epidemic. Based on Michael Crichton’s bestselling novel that created national paranoia for its topical relevance to the first moon landing, this is a surprisingly accurate and scientific chiller.

results.title: Red rock west
results.creator_credit: John Dahl, Steve Golin, Sigurjon Sighvatsson and Red Rock Films
results.brief_description: Michael Williams (Nicholas Cage) is an ex-marine, down on his luck and desperate for work. When he stumbles into the dusty desert town of Red Rock, he is mistakenly identified by the local saloon owner (J.T. Walsh) as the hired gun commissioned to kill his unfaithful wife, Suzanne (Lara Flynn-Boyle). Taking the money but choosing instead to warn her, Michael is faced with another indecent proposal when Suzanne doubles the offer - to kill her husband! Again, Michael accepts the “job” and tries to leave town before his luck changes but on the road leaving Red Rock, he discovers it already has - the real killer has just arrived!

results.title: Soylent green
results.creator_credit: Richard Fleischer, Russell Thacher, Walter Seltzer and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: The year is 2022. New York City is teeming with a writhing mass of 40 million citizens, most of whom are unemployed. Strawberry jam costs $150.00 a jar and voluntary death is encouraged by Government Clinics. Food as we know it is very scarce and the people rely on a biscuit-like foodstuff called Soylent. Detective Thorn (Charlton Heston) is a harried cop investigating the death of a rich magnate (Joseph Cotten) in the dictatorial Soylent company. Edward G. Robinson, in his final screen role plays an aged and wise researcher who remembers what the earth was like with trees, vegetables and democracy. As the threads of the murder unravel, Heston finds himself face to face with the hideous truth about Soylent. Displaying an intensity of poetic and visual invention, this provocative film is a nightmarish vision of a world slowly choking itself to death. Based upon the novel by Harry Harrison.

results.title: One, two, three
results.creator_credit: Billy Wilder, Pyramid Films, United Artists Corporation and Mirsch
results.brief_description: James Cagney shines in a virtuoso, verbal machine-gun fire perfomance as an American executive trying to sell Coca Cola to the Russians while preventing his boss’s daughter from marrying an East-German communist. How the would-be groom is converted into a capitalist before her parents arrive is part of this first-class farce.

results.title: The Public enemy
results.creator_credit: William Wellman and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: James Cagney plays Tom Powers, the son of a Chicago policeman, growing up in the city slums where, as a boy, he naturally turns to petty crime as a way of life. As an adult he becomes a successful big-time liquor racketeer. Tom Power has no socially redeemimg traits. He takes pleasure in even the most petty of physical insults, such as grinding half a grapefruit into the startled face of Mae Clark. Cagney’s raw ferocious portrayal of a vicious criminal is masterful and the film is a classic in its genre. Also stars Jean Harlow and Joan Blondell.
